awd_abstract_narration: Experiments on ductile materials have indicated that cavity                formation and coalescence is a major failure mechanism.  The                    present research will consider dynamic cavitation in certain                    metals and polymers.  In the physical situation to be modeled, a                stress wave is sent to the center of a solid ball of the                        material.  There is no void initially.  After the wave leaves the               center, a hole may develop in the material as the result of a                   singular solution of the underlying equations.                                       This work may lead to a simple predictor of failure                        initiation in situations where the loads increase slowly and                    monotonically.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF SOUTHERN ILLINOIS UNIVERSITY
